title: E field - graph of E vs d for charged metal sphere

content.question: A solid metal sphere has a radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and a net charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> of the electric field as a function of distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from the center of the sphere?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of two line segments in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled d and the value R is indicated just to the right of the origin. The vertical axis is labeled E. The first line segment begins at the origin, slants upward and to the right steeply, and ends above R halfway up the vertical axis. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, slants downward and to the right gradually, and ends along the horizontal axis near its end.
